title.narrative: Gavi Programmes et Impact pour République arabe syrienne (la)
Syrian Arab Republic: Gavi Programmes and Impact

description.narrative: Aperçu de l'ensemble des soutiens de Gavi à République arabe syrienne (la). À ce niveau, l'évaluation conjointe, le plan pluriannuel du pays, le rapport d'étape annuel sont fournis comme pièces justificatives. Pour plus de détails sur chaque soutien, veuillez-vous référer aux activités ci-dessous.

Parent Activity of Gavi's Support to Syrian Arab Republic At this level, Joint Appraisal, Country Multi Year Plan, Annual Progress Report are provided as supporting documents. In 2020/2021, as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, Multi-stakeholder dialogue (MSD) documents temporarily replaced the traditional Joint Appraisal to ensure that Gavi’s continuing support to the EPI programme be aligned with realities at country level. For details on each vaccine please refer to child activities.

Note technique: Toutes les activités des pays soutenus par Gavi ont un statut «mise en œuvre» et par conséquent, aucune date de fin réelle est déterminée. Les pays éligibles peuvent soumettre des propositions et demandes de soutien à Gavi à tout moment.
Technical note: all Gavi Country activities have a status of "Implementation" and no Actual End Date, as qualifying countries are able to submit proposals to Gavi at any stage.

participating-org.narrative: The Government of Syrian Arab Republic

description.narrative: The comprehensive multi-year plan (cMYP) is a single plan which consolidates several immunisation activities. It is a key planning and management tool for national immunisation programmes. It addresses global, national, and subnational immunisation objectives and strategies, and evaluates the costs and financing of the programme in line with the WHO-UNICEF Global Immunization Vision and Strategy 2006-2015. Gavi requires countries to submit a cMYP along with the standard proposal form when applying for Gavi support (ISS, INS, and NVS). In 2006, over 50 countries had developed cMYPs using the WHO-UNICEF cMYP guidelines and costing tool. The cMYP replaces the financial sustainability plan (FSP), used to assess the funding challenges of a country's national immunisation programme within the broader health financing context and to describe the government’s approach to mobilising and effectively using resources to support medium- and long-term immunisation objectives.
Tender opportunities with Gavi. Please note - not all opportunities are administered or made available through Gavi
